channel.title: How to Start a Startup, free online course from Stanford
channel.description:
https://itunes.apple.com/us/course/how-to-start-a-startup/id951932247
"Everything we know about how to start a startup, for free, from some of the world experts. This collection is designed to be a sort of one-class business course for people who want to start startups.
"We cover how to come up with ideas and evaluate them, how to get users and grow, how to do sales and marketing, how to hire, how to raise money, company culture, operations and management, business strategy, and more."

item.title: How to Start a Startup, free online course from Stanford
item.dc:creator: cadbloke
item.description:
I’m listening to that podcast series atm, it’s good.

Also worth a listen, Google “seth godin’s startup school” it’s on iTunes etc.

Read full topic
item.source: How to Start a Startup, free online course from Stanford

item.title: How to Start a Startup, free online course from Stanford
item.dc:creator: globalwj
item.description:
I took notes on the classes (http://personalopz.com/blog/category/notes/how-to-start-a-startup/). There is a lot of actionable advice there as opposed to the more inspirational classes (Stanford’s Entrepreneurial Thought Leaders). Love them all.

The class that stood out to me the most was class 18 (Legal and Accounting Basics for Startups). Should be a must watch for anybody about to start a business of any type.

Read full topic
item.source: How to Start a Startup, free online course from Stanford
